page.title: 16RECREATION IN DEERNESS (2)
page.content: Some men and boys are part of an Orkney wide group, which collects and restores vintage engines. From October to March there are monthly{Whist and {Euchre Drives}for the adults and {Beetle and Dominoes}for the children. Towards the end of each year the {Harvest Home}takes place, organised by the Hall Committee. Thanks are given for the harvest and a meal and dancing follows. Sometimes{concerts}are given by people from other districts, but, as there is a wealth of local talent, they are often given by parishioners themselves. Each year they include the play entered in the Orkney Drama Festival by the Young Farmers. Not only do they{entertain}themselves, but arrange variety programmes to entertain other groups.
